questionTitle: Food prices have been ________ steadily for at least twenty years.
I'll have to study very hard, ________ I can pass the exam.
You ________ to eat if you don't feel like it.
We'll play tennis and ________ we'll have lunch.
He has to go to Canada for the next ________ of his training.
When the meeting had finished, they went ________ the plan once again.
We locked the animals in the cage to ________ them from getting away.
You're ________ your time trying to persuade him; he'll never help you.
Their last cook was better than their ________ one.
I am grateful to you for being so patient ________ him.
Do you mean to say you exchanged that lovely car ________ this?
The weather was ________ the exceptionally poor harvest.
She is teaching two classes and is examining at a literature exam tomorrow. ________, she is chairing a meeting at the Pen Club.
I don't see any ________ in arriving early at the theatre if the show doesn't start until 9 o'clock.
His application for a visa was turned ________ by the consulate.
Shopping malls account for 60 percent of the retail business done in the United States because they are controlled environments which ________ concerns about the weather.
It is ________ impossible to tell the twins apart.
The man known as Bonnie Prince Charlie claimed that he was the ________ heir to the throne.
The rather humid climate in no way ________ from the beauty of the place.
________ no need to buy traveller's cheques since most countries take credit cards.
